audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Generic promises of 'productivity gains, cost reductions, and competitive advantage' describe optimization, not transformation. No evidence of business model change or new value creation.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Vague promotional language with no specific metrics or demonstrated outcomes. 'Promises to be' indicates future speculation, not current transformation.
audited_claims.notes: Classic Tier 1 efficiency language disguised as transformation. No strategic novelty demonstrated.

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Describes internal operational improvements and faster customer service - classic efficiency gains within existing business model, not transformation.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: No specific metrics provided. 'Driving operational improvements' and 'reducing costs' are generic claims without quantification.

apqc_functions.name: Plan and manage customer service contacts

audited_claims.notes: This is clearly Tier 1 optimization - doing existing things better, not doing new things.

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Helping clients access data and generate content to grow AUM is a feature enhancement, not business model transformation. Clearwater's core business (investment accounting/reporting) remains unchanged.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Speculative language ('will empower') with no metrics on actual AUM growth or client adoption. No evidence this creates new revenue streams for Clearwater.
audited_claims.notes: Enhanced client tools within existing SaaS model - not transformation. Would be Tier 1 if it had metrics.

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Infrastructure cost savings from cloud migration is pure operational efficiency, not strategic transformation. No change to how value is created or delivered.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific metric ($75k savings) but this is clearly a Tier 1 efficiency gain, not transformation.
audited_claims.notes: Misclassified - this is a clear Tier 1 case (cost optimization through infrastructure change).

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Automation for time savings in ticket management is operational efficiency, not business model change. Core value proposition unchanged.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Qualitative description ('huge time savings') without specific metrics. Source appears to be about internal IT operations.

apqc_functions.name: Plan and manage customer service contacts

audited_claims.notes: Another clear Tier 1 case - process automation for efficiency gains.

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Handling 200% more resources through infrastructure improvements is scaling efficiency, not transformation. Enables growth within existing model rather than creating new model.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific metric (200% more resources) from credible source, but describes operational scaling, not strategic change.
audited_claims.notes: Operational scaling capability - Tier 1. Enables existing business to grow, doesn't change what the business is.

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Developer productivity improvements (faster provisioning) are internal efficiency gains, not customer-facing transformation or new value creation.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Excellent specific metrics (2 weeks to 2 hours, 5 minutes for sandbox) from authoritative source, but clearly operational efficiency.
audited_claims.notes: High-quality Tier 1 case with excellent metrics, but definitively not transformation.

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Revenue growth within existing SaaS model is business performance, not transformation. No evidence of new business model or value creation method.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific financial metrics from official earnings, but standard business growth rather than transformation evidence.
audited_claims.notes: Financial performance metrics don't demonstrate transformation - could result from Tier 1 improvements or market growth.

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: EBITDA improvement is financial performance within existing model, not evidence of business transformation.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific financial metrics from official source, but measures operational efficiency rather than strategic change.
audited_claims.notes: Financial efficiency gains - could be result of Tier 1 improvements but not transformation itself.

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Cash flow improvements are financial outcomes, not transformation indicators. No evidence of new value creation mechanisms.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific metrics from official earnings, but operational/financial performance rather than strategic transformation.
audited_claims.notes: Strong financial performance but no indication this stems from business model transformation.

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Free cash flow growth is financial performance metric, not transformation evidence. Could result from efficiency gains within existing model.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific metric (117% growth) from official source, but measures financial outcomes rather than strategic change.
audited_claims.notes: Financial performance indicator - not evidence of transformation.

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: ARR growth in SaaS model is standard business performance, not transformation. No evidence of new revenue streams or business model change.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific financial metrics from official earnings, but standard SaaS growth metrics rather than transformation indicators.
audited_claims.notes: Standard SaaS growth metrics - successful execution of existing model, not transformation.

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: High retention rate indicates customer satisfaction with existing service, not business model transformation. Measures success within current model.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific metric (99% retention) from official source, but measures operational excellence rather than strategic transformation.
audited_claims.notes: Excellent operational metric but indicates success within existing model, not transformation.

tier_verification: This case is misclassified as tier 1. All claims describe either: (1) operational efficiency improvements (cloud migration, automation, infrastructure scaling), (2) AI-enhanced features within existing SaaS model, or (3) strong financial performance within existing business model. No evidence of business model transformation, new market creation, or AI as core value driver. This appears to be a collection of tier 1 optimization cases with strong financial results from a successful SaaS company. Should be reclassified as tier 1.
